item.title: Dumped van, 30th October
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping on anglesea avenue, 30th October
item.description:
We are struggling with constant fly-tipping on Anglesea Avenue. The monthly cleanups are only a temporary fix — rubbish piles up again within days. It’s becoming unbearable for residents. We urgently need a permanent solution such as CCTV or stricter enforcement. If this issue isn’t addressed soon, we will have to escalate it to higher council levels. Please take immediate action — we can’t keep living like this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anglesea Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cabinet Damage, 30th October
item.description:
There was a recent RTC at this location and the green cabinet on the corner was badly damaged. It has been taped off for over a month now, is anything happening with this?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16-18, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike locked to bike stand outside Sainsbury's., 30th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Half Moon Lane, Herne Hill, London

item.title: Cabinet Damage?, 30th October
item.description:
There is a pile of broken metal that looks to be the remains of an electrical cabinet or something (there are 2 other cabinets here) at this location. There are some metal hazard barriers around it, but they keep getting blown/knocked over. Is anything being done with this? Its been like this for over a month now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
